Utils
namespace
Utils

Contains many commonly used utility functions.  Note: Communication with our devices (wireless and inertial) is done in Big Endian.

Types
Endianness

The possible endians that a value can be in.

Functions
valueTypeSize
uint32 valueTypeSize(
ValueType type
)

Gets the size of the ValueType

Parameters
type
ValueType

The ValueType to get the size of

Returns

The size of the given ValueType

Exceptions

  • Error: The value type requested does not have a given size

msb
uint8 msb(
uint16 value
)

Gets the Most Significant Byte from the 2-Byte unsigned integer

Parameters
value
uint16

the 2-Byte unsigned integer (in system endianness) to find the MSB from

Returns

The Most Significant Byte of the passed in value

uint16 value
)

Gets the Least Significant Byte from the 2-Byte unsigned integer

Parameters

uint16

the 2-Byte unsigned integer (in system endianness) to find the LSB from

Returns

The Least Significant Byte of the passed in value

split_int16
void split_int16(
int16 value,
uint8 &low,
uint8 &high,
Endianness endian = bigEndian
)

Converts the 2-byte signed integer into its individual 2 bytes.

Parameters
value
int16

the 2 byte int16 (in system endianness) to convert into bytes

low
uint8&

holds the low memory location result

high
uint8&

holds the high memory location result

endian
Endianness

The Endianness that the result bytes should be in.  ie. Big endian means low will be the msb, high will be the lsb. Little endian means low will be the lsb, high will be the msb.

make_int16
int16 make_int16(
uint8 low,
uint8 high,
Endianness endian = bigEndian
)

Gets the 2-byte signed integer (in system endianness) from 2 individual bytes

Parameters
low
uint8

the low memory location byte

high
uint8

the high memory location byte

endian
Endianness

The Endianness that the passed in bytes are in.  ie. Big endian means low = msb, high = lsb. Little endian means low = lsb, high = msb

Returns

The 2-byte int16 (in system endianness) built from the given bytes.

make_int32
int32 make_int32(
uint8 low,
uint8 byte2,
uint8 byte3,
uint8 high,
Endianness endian = bigEndian
)

Gets the 4-byte signed integer (in system endianness) from 4 individual bytes

Parameters
low
uint8

the low memory location byte

byte2
uint8

the second byte to be used

byte3
uint8

the third byte to be used

high
uint8

the high memory location byte

endian
Endianness

The Endianness that the passed in bytes are in.  ie. Big endian means low = msb, high = lsb. Little endian means low = lsb, high = msb

Returns

The 4-byte int32 (in system endianness) built from the given bytes.

make_uint16
uint16 make_uint16(
uint8 low,
uint8 high,
Endianness endian = bigEndian
)

Gets the 2-byte unsigned integer (in system endianness) from 2 individual bytes.  Parameters: low - the low memory location byte high - the high memory location byte endian - The Endianness that the passed in bytes are in.  ie. Big endian means low = msb, high = lsb. Little endian means low = lsb, high = msb

Returns

The 2-byte uint16 (in system endianness) built from the given bytes.

the lowest memory byte to be used

the 8-byte double (in system endian) built from the 8 bytes

round
float round(
float value
)

Returns the value that is nearest to the provided value to round. (ie. round(2.5) == 3, round(2.4) == 2)

Parameters
value
float

The value to round

Returns

The rounded result.

removeChar
void removeChar(
std::string &src,
char charToRemove
)

Removes all found instances of a char from a string.

Parameters
src
std::string&

The string to remove the character from. This will be changed to hold the result.

charToRemove
char

The character to remove all instances of from the string.

removeStr
void removeStr(
std::string &src,
const std::string &strToRemove
)

Removes all found instances of a string from another string.

Parameters
str

The string to remove the substring from. This will be changed to hold the result.

strtoRemove
const std::string&

The substring to remove all instances of from the string.

containsStr
bool containsStr(
const std::string &src,
const std::string &containsThis
)

Checks whether or not a string contains another string.

Parameters
src
const std::string&

The source string.

containsThis
const std::string&

The string to attempt to find in the source string.

Returns

true if the string was found in the source string, false if it was not found.

bitIsSet
template<typename T> bool bitIsSet(
T value,
size_t bitPos
)

Checks if a specific bit is set in the given value.

Parameters
value
T

The value to check the bit of.

bitPos
size_t

The bit position to check if it is set. (0 = far right)

Returns

true if the bit is set, false if it is not set.

setBit
template<typename T> void setBit(
T &value,
size_t bitPos,
bool enable
)

Sets a specific bit to on or off.

Parameters
value
T&

The value to update (will be updated with the result).

bitPos
size_t

The bit position to set. (0 = far right)

enable
bool

true to set the bit to on, false to set the bit to off.

isNaN
template<typename T> bool isNaN(
T value
)

Checks whether the given value is NaN or not.

Parameters
value
T

The value to check if it is a NaN.

Returns

true if the value is a NaN, false otherwise.

checkBounds_min
template<typename T> void checkBounds_min(
T &value,
T min
)

Checks that a value is not below a minimum value. If the value is less than the min, the value is changed to that min value.

Parameters
value
T&

The value to check

min
T

The minimum value to make sure the value is greater than or equal to

checkBounds_max
template<typename T> void checkBounds_max(
T &value,
T max
)

Checks that a value is not above a maximum value. If the value is greater than the max, the value is changed to that max value.

Parameters
value
T&

The value to check

max
T

The maximum value to make sure the value is less than or equal to.

eraseIf
template<typename Container, class T> void eraseIf(
Container &c,
T &&t
)

Takes a container (such as a vector) and removes elements from it if they don't match a certain predicate.

Parameters
c
Container&

The container to check and remove elements from, as a reference.

t
T&&

The predicate that will return false for elements that should be removed from the container.

)

Performs a boost::lexical_cast from a value to an std::string

Parameters
value
T

The value to convert to a string.

Returns

The string result of the lexical cast.
